intro: Microtropis mayana, commonly known as the Mayan microtropis, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Microtropis mayana is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
